name: Day Type and Number
description: The DTN data type is used to represent specific days with numeric values, commonly used for scheduling, billing cycles, and temporal calculations in healthcare environments. It combines day type classification with associated numeric values to support complex scheduling algorithms, billing period calculations, and calendar-based healthcare operations. DTN enables precise specification of day-based rules and calculations essential for healthcare workflow management and financial operations.

DTN.1.name: Day Type
DTN.1.description: Specifies the type or classification of the day (e.g., weekday, weekend, holiday, business day). Determines how the day should be treated in scheduling and calculation algorithms.

DTN.2.name: Number of Days
DTN.2.description: The numeric value associated with the day type, such as number of days in a period, day sequence number, or calculation factor. Used for temporal calculations and scheduling algorithms.

constraints.dayType: Day type should reference valid values from table 0149
